incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates with SAML Authentication

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're pleased to report that our upstream provider has addressed this issue. We will continue to closely monitor the situation and will provide additional updates if necessary.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are investigating elevated SAML authentication errors, where users are prompted with a "This web property is not accessible via this address." error. We have identified that the root cause is linked to an issue with an upstream provider.

Please note that existing tokens and sessions are not impacted and continue to function normally. We are actively collaborating with our upstream provider to resolve the issue. We will provide updates as more information becomes available.

Due to a problem with GitHub, some commits pushed to GitHub between 01:45 and 02:15 UTC might have trouble being deployed. Deployments from other Git providers and CLI are not affected. Affected customers may want to push again to trigger a build. For more information, see the GitHub status "Incident with Actions, Pull Requests and Webhooks": https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/spz29wshw9mh

On 8/25/23, between the time of 15:15 UTC and 15:51 UTC, Vercel experienced downtime with our runtime logs due to a connection loss with our upstream provider. During that time, users would have been unable to access and view their logs within their Vercel dashboard.

The service was restored at 15:51 UTC on 08/25 with no data loss observed.
This incident has been resolved. Any failed builds will need to be manually re-run and will not be retried automatically.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating a percentage of builds failing with the error "Client network socket disconnected before secure TLS connection was established".

A portion of our customers who have deployed serverless functions using a Vercel team between July 17th (12:30p UTC) and July 18th (8:54p UTC) could be experiencing truncated HTML content when their server renders on Vercel. A fix has been released. The issue has been mitigated, but people may have apps deployed with a bad version. Please redeploy your project to have the fix included.
This incident has been resolved.

We are observing a degradation in DNS updates due to an ongoing issue with our upstream provider. Existing DNS records are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Due to an upstream service disruption, we were seeing certificate issuance delays. The upstream provider has investigated the root cause of this issuance disruption and have restored services back to normal. We are monitoring the upstream implementation of the fix for the issue experienced earlier. At this time, serverless function creations and invocations are working as expected.

Serverless Functions are experiencing service degradation in the IAD1 (us-east-1) region due to a major outage impacting the AWS Lambda service. For more information, see the AWS status at https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status. If affected, please update your region to cle1 and redeploy (https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/serverless-functions/regions).

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates in Serverless Functions

incident_updates.body:
A change to optimize outbound HTTP requests from Serverless Functions started gradually rolling out under a feature flag on 4/21 15:21 UTC to a subset of customers. This resulted in some serverless functions deployed after the change being unable to send the request correctly when using a third-party library that instruments serverless functions.

On 4/23 16:34 UTC, our on-call team disabled the flag to turn off the change after identifying the root cause through details provided by affected customers. After the rollback, customers were able to mitigate the issue by manually redeploying the app.

This incident only affected Serverless Functions.
